title: A Scorekeeper Vignette
text: variables coded ways slightly odd. instance, ccq360 descriptive name, response ‘never’ corresponds value 1. Example row binge_scoresheet
code: frq(binge_raw$ccq370) #> B13a/B12a: Respondent felt out of control when on a binge (x) <numeric>  #> # total N=10 valid N=6 mean=2.17 sd=0.98 #>  #> Value |                   Label | N | Raw % | Valid % | Cum. % #> -------------------------------------------------------------- #> -9999 | Consent withdrawn by YP | 0 |     0 |    0.00 |   0.00 #>   -11 |    Triplet / quadruplet | 0 |     0 |    0.00 |   0.00 #>   -10 |           Not completed | 0 |     0 |    0.00 |   0.00 #>    -1 |             No response | 0 |     0 |    0.00 |   0.00 #>     1 |            Yes, usually | 2 |    20 |   33.33 |  33.33 #>     2 |          Yes, sometimes | 1 |    10 |   16.67 |  50.00 #>     3 |                      No | 3 |    30 |   50.00 | 100.00 #>  <NA> |                    <NA> | 4 |    40 |    <NA> |   <NA> knitr::kable(head(binge_scoresheet[10,]), align = 'l', caption = 'Example row from binge_scoresheet')

title: Authors and Citation
text: Katherine Schaumberg. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schaumberg K (2022). scorekeeper: Score Multi-item Assessments. https://github.com/embark-lab/scorekeeper, https://embark-lab.github.io/scorekeeper.
code: @Manual{,   title = {scorekeeper: Score Multi-item Assessments},   author = {Katherine Schaumberg},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/embark-lab/scorekeeper, https://embark-lab.github.io/scorekeeper}, }

title: Score Multi-item Assessments
text: data cleaning package, Katherine Schaumberg goal scorekeeper support development accessible, approachable, reproducible scoring algorithms multi-item measures. package designed psychological assessment measures mind, can broadly applicable multi-item assessments. package requires raw data file scoresheet (metadata file) input. Scorekeeper uses dplyr functionality manipulate clean data systematic way, specified scoresheet. scoresheet can serve resource make data cleaning process reproducible easily shared (e.g. colleague like score measure way project different sample, can send post scoresheet easily replicate scoring algorithm – need send post additional code). scoresheets structured easily developed interpreted compared raw code, also recommend companion text file outlining step data cleaning maximize ease interpretation sharing others (future self!). Currently, scoresheets must formatted accordance guidelines outlined ‘operation’ functions steps proceed appropriate order. recommend building scoresheet step--step. Add one ‘step’ time data manipulaton complete error checking running functions scorekeeper package build scoresheet. Necessary columns scoresheet include: raw_vars : raw variable list raw variables needed operation new_var: desired name new variable created operation label: new variable label, needed operation: operation preform (select, filter_at, recode, sum, if_else, case_when, rename) step: identifies order operations preformed, starting ‘1’. recommend entering raw metadata ‘0’ increase transparency scoring method sharing scoresheet val_labs: value labels new variable new_vals: values recoded recode operation. Follow convention ‘old’ = ‘new’, commas separating old/new pair if_condition: logical condition evaluated if_else operation if_true_return: value returned ‘if_condition’ == TRUE if_else operations else_return: value returned ‘if_condition’ != TRUE if_else operations code: code performing ‘filter_at’ ‘case_when’ operation required columns scoresheet currently limited flexibility. anticipate adding additional functionality future. Enter NA elements unnecessary given operation. Current operations supported : select : selects variables identify scoresheet$raw_vars. filter_at: filters rows dataset. Use filter_at dplyr conventions using scoresheet$code recode: recodes variable new variable, using values defined scoresheet$new_vals sum: sums variables identified scoresheet$raw_vars. Provides weighted unweighted sums, along number proportion NA values sum if_else : creates new variable defined scoresheet$if_condition, scoresheet$if_true return, soresheet$else_return case_when : creates new variable using case_when code defined scoresheet$code

title: Score Multi-item Assessments
text: Install scorekeeper GitHub repository. remotes package installed, first install remotes package. install R/scorekeeper using install_github function remotes.

what:
score function
The score function completes all scoring for a single step of a scoresheet. operations are conducted in the following order:
select, if_else, recode, sum, case_when, filter_at — score

title: Select Variables Using scoresheet — select_vars
text: raw raw data object scoresheet formatted scoresheet object. Key variables operation raw_vars. select operation currently takes list raw_vars selects variables. Remember select necessary variables identification data scoring measure (can later stitch tibbles back together analysis needed). Currently, must enter names variables like simple, comma separated list. use shorthand expressions (e.g. starts_with c(1:7) work input. Full variables names necessary. Additional flexibility function planned future releases
